newsitem.title: UK: NWE cracked fuel oils firmer, but drifts from high.
newsitem.headline: NWE cracked fuel oils firmer, but drifts from high.

text.p: NWE cracked fuel oil prices were firmer in line with crude on Wednesday, but traders said that apart from some light play on the barge market trade was thin.
High sulphur barges continued to get extra lift from cargo pricing in early trade but this support faded later and prices drifted off early highs.
High sulphur barges traded several times at $91 a tonne fob refinery Rotterdam helped by one trader's cargo pricing strategy, but prices settled back to value around $89 later.
Antwerp liftings were on offer at slightly weaker levels to Rotterdam with several players seen long of product at the port.
High sulphur cargoes firmed around $3 per tonne to value around $88 cif NWE early but trade was thin and a slight softening in crude pulled off some of the gain.

Traders said there was little fresh demand from end-users at these higher levels and firm prices for fob stems in NWE continued to limit arbitrage options into the Mediterranean where recent Eastern arbitrage has drawn on supplies.

The low sulphur barge and cargo markets remained in the doldrums. Outright prices strengthened with crude but the high/low sulphur spread widened with low sulphur's rise limited by slack buying interest.
